This api is used as a proxy to call [Identity Provider - Send Binding OTP Endpoint](https://mosip.stoplight.io/docs/identity-provider/a34e5371d4876-send-binding-otp-endpoint-draft) api internally.

authFactorType.description: Auth factor type to be binded for the provided key.

format.description: Format of the auth factor type supported in the wallet app. Right now Inji supports only jwt.

individualId.description: The individual id. UIN or VID.

publicKey.description: The public key of the wallet app.

authFactorType.description: Defines the type of auth challenge. It should be same as authfactor.type (oauth-details response).

challenge.description: Actual challenge as string. A jwt in case of inji.

get.description: This API fetches and allows searching for Credential Types offered by the issuer, all sourced from the issuer's well-known configuration. Since version 0.16.0, this endpoint is deprecated and will be removed in a future release. Use issuers new endpoint issuers/{issuer-id}/configuration instead.

logo.alt_text: a square logo of a Veridonia
a square logo of a Veridonia

parameters.name: issuer-id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the credential issuer.

post.description: This API is responsible for generating PDFs for the received VC content. It fetches display properties from the well-known configuration of the issuer and incorporates them into the predefined template of the PDF file.

302.description:
Found

**Success Case :**

```json

{redirectUri}#vp_token={base64_encoded_vpToken}&presentation_submission={url_encoded_presentation_submission}

```
**Error Case :** 

```json

{redirectUri}?error={error_codes}&error_messages={error_messages}

```


**Possible Error Codes and Error Messages :**

- **invalid_request** - "Some incorrect parameters in the request"
- **unsupported_format** - "No VC of this format is found"
- **resource_not_found** - "The requested resource doesn’t exist."
- **server_unavailable** - "The server is not reachable right now."
- **resource_expired** - "The requested resource expired."
- **resource_invalid** - "The requested resource is invalid."
- **request_timed_out** - "We are unable to process your request right now"
- **uri_too_long** - "Resource URI is too long to be handled"
- **invalid_client** - "The requested client doesn’t match."
- **invalid_redirect_uri** - "The requested redirect URI doesn’t match."
- **internal_server_error** - "We are unable to process request now"

parameters.name: presentation_definition
parameters.description: URL Encoded Value of the presentation Definition

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: Client ID of the registered verifier

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: One of the Redirect uri of the registered verifiers

get.summary: Retrieve user metadata from the database
get.description: This API is secured using session-based authentication. When a request is made, the server retrieves the session ID from the Cookie header and uses it to fetch session details from Redis. From the session, it extracts the user's unique identifier (typically the sub field provided by the identity provider) along with the clientRegistrationId. These values are then used to retrieve the user's metadata from the database. If successful, the API returns the user's profile information. If any issue occurs such as missing user data or server error then an appropriate error response is returned.

200.description: User profile retrieved successfully from the Database

value.errorMessage: User not found. Please check your credentials or login again
Failed to connect to the shared database while fetching User Metadata data from the database
An unexpected error occurred while downloading and storing user metadata into database

get.summary: Retrieve user metadata from the stored redis session
get.description: This API is secured using session-based authentication. When a request is made, the server retrieves the session ID from the Cookie header and uses it to fetch session details from Redis. It then attempts to retrieve the user's metadata directly from the session. If the metadata is available, the API returns the user's profile information otherwise an appropriate error response is returned.

200.description: User profile retrieved successfully from the session

value.errorMessage: No user metadata present in cache
An unexpected error occurred while retrieving user metadata from cache

post.summary: Download and store a Verifiable Credential under a specific Wallet
post.description: This API is secured using session-based authentication. Upon receiving a request, the session ID is extracted from the Cookie header and used to retrieve session details from Redis for authentication. It then retrieves the wallet key from the session and use it to decrypt the signing algorithm's secret key(which is used for signing the JWT in credential request) and encrypt the downloaded Verifiable Credential. If the process completes successfully, the credential is stored in the database and certain fields will be returned in the response. In case of any issues, an appropriate error response is returned.

parameters.name: walletId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the user's wallet where the credential will be stored

code.description: Authorization code received from the identity provider

redirect_uri.description: Redirect URI used in the OAuth 2.0 flow

code_verifier.description: PKCE code verifier associated with the authorization code

issuer.description: Unique identifier of the credential Issuer

credential.description: Type of the credential to be downloaded

vcStorageExpiryLimitInTimes.description: Optional limit for how many times the user is allowed to share the Verifiable Credential. If not provided, it defaults to -1

locale.description: Language preference in which the user expects the Verifiable Credential to be rendered

200.description: Verifiable Credential downloaded and stored successfully

400.description: Bad request - API not accessible or request parameters invalid

value.errorMessage: Wallet key is missing in session
Failed to connect to the shared database while storing Verifiable Credential data into the database
Unexpected error occurred while downloading and storing Verifiable Credential

get.summary: Fetch all credentials for the given wallet
get.description: This API is secured using session-based authentication. When a request is made, the session ID is extracted from the Cookie header and used to fetch session details from Redis for authentication. It then retrieves the wallet key from the session and uses it to decrypt all stored Verifiable Credentials for the given wallet. If successful, it returns a list of credentials otherwise an appropriate error is returned.

parameters.name: walletId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the user's wallet from where the credential will be fetched

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Locale is used to determine the language in which credentials should be rendered

value.errorMessage: Wallet key is missing in session
Failed to connect to the shared database while fetching Verifiable Credential from the database
Unexpected error occurred while fetching Verifiable Credential

get.summary: Fetch a Verifiable Credential by ID
get.description: This API retrieves a specific Verifiable Credential for the provided wallet ID and credential ID. It uses session-based authentication. The session ID is extracted from the Cookie header and used to validate the session and retrieve the wallet encryption key. Depending on the action (inline or download), the response disposition will change. On success, it returns a PDF file as response content.

parameters.name: walletId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the user's wallet

parameters.name: credentialId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the credential to be retrieved

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Language preference for rendering the Verifiable Credential

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Controls how the credential should be displayed (inline or as a download)

Content-Disposition.description: Indicates if the file is displayed inline or downloaded

value.errorMessage: Wallet key is missing in session
Failed to connect to the shared database while fetching Verifiable Credential from the database
Unexpected error occurred while fetching Verifiable Credential

post.description: This API is secured using session-based authentication. The session ID is extracted from the Cookie header and used to retrieve session details from Redis for authentication. The user ID is then obtained from the session and along with the provided wallet name and PIN is used to create a new wallet in the database. If the wallet is created successfully, a unique identifier for the wallet is returned otherwise an appropriate error response is provided.

requestBody.description: Wallet creation request containing the wallet name and wallet PIN

schema.description: Unique identifier of the Wallet stored in the database

value.errorMessage: Pin should be numeric with 4 or 6 digits.

500.description: Internal server error while creating wallet

value.errorMessage: An unexpected error occurred while creating the wallet

get.summary: Retrieve all wallets for the user
get.description: This API is secured using session-based authentication. Upon receiving a request, the session is first retrieved using the session ID extracted from the Cookie header to authenticate the user. Once authenticated, the user's ID is obtained from the session stored in Redis. Using this user ID, the API fetches all wallets associated with the user from the database and returns them. If an error occurs while retrieving the wallets, an appropriate error response is returned.

value.errorMessage: An unexpected error occurred while retrieving user wallets

post.description: This API is secured using session-based authentication. Upon receiving a request, the session is first retrieved using the session ID extracted from the Cookie header to authenticate the user. Once authenticated, the user's ID is obtained from the session stored in Redis. Using this user ID along with the provided wallet ID and PIN, the corresponding wallet key is fetched and stored in the session. If successful then the API returns a response containing the wallet ID otherwise an appropriate error response is returned.

parameters.name: walletId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the wallet to be unlocked

value.errorMessage: An unexpected error occurred while retrieving the wallet details

SessionAuth.name: SESSION
SessionAuth.description: Session-based authentication using a session ID stored in the cookie. The client must send the 'SESSION' cookie (e.g., SESSION=<session-id>) with each request.

display_name.description: The display name of the user provided by the Identity Provider

profile_picture_url.description: The URL of the user's profile picture provided by the Identity Provider

email.description: The email address of the user provided by the Identity Provider

credential_type.description: The name of the Credential Type issued by the Issuer

credential_id.description: Unique Identifier of the Credential in the database

walletPin.description: PIN used to unlock the Wallet

errorCode.description: It represents the type or category of the error

errorMessage.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error
